本文由环保摄影师托马斯•佩斯查克撰写，回顾了他从小对海洋的幻想及其职业生涯的发展。作者描绘了自己童年时对海洋生物的热爱，尤其是色彩斑斓的鱼群和优雅的海龟，并回忆了自己10岁时第一次潜水的经历。作为前海洋生物学家，他在过去40年中为《国家地理杂志》和“拯救我们的海洋”基金会拍摄了各种海洋生物，从巨型鲨鱼到小型鱼类。尽管他有幸探索了美妙的海洋景观，但他也意识到，随着人类活动的增加，纯净的海洋正变得愈加稀少，面临着越来越多的威胁。文章传达了对海洋环境保护的关注，强调了每个人都能影响海洋，并呼吁人们重视这一问题。

此外，文中探讨了摄影在传播爱与保护生态中的重要性，作者自认为是人类与动物之间的桥梁，通过摄影揭示隐藏在海洋深处的动物与生态系统的美丽与神秘。详细描述了在南非观察到的“沙丁鱼潮”现象，强调了海豚与鲨鱼在捕猎沙丁鱼时的共生关系，展示了自然界中物种间的相互依赖。作者还提到在马尔代夫的魔鬼鱼聚集地，描绘了其生活环境及食物链的细微之处。整体风格感性而深思，语气中带有对美好海洋的怀念和对未来的忧虑，同时充满热情与敬畏，旨在唤起人们对海洋生物及其生态系统的关注与爱护。
new_tgt_summary: Thomas Pescechak, a former marine biologist turned environmental photographer, reflects on his lifelong fascination with the ocean, inspired by its vibrant life and beauty. Over 40 years, he has explored diverse ocean landscapes and captured images for National Geographic and the "Save Our Seas" Foundation. His memorable experiences include swimming with a humpback whale in Canada, observing green sea turtles in Mozambique, and witnessing the "sardine run" in South Africa, where migrating sardines are hunted by dolphins and sharks, showcasing a unique coexistence. He emphasizes the importance of raising awareness about ocean ecosystems to foster love and protection for them. Despite the increasing human threats that make the pristine ocean he once dreamed of harder to find, Pescechak believes that spreading love is key to bringing about change. He also recounts close encounters with non-threatening sharks during the sardine run and his journey to the Maldives, where devil rays gather near Hanifaru Island to feed on small shrimp and crabs. Ultimately, he feels that while shocking photographs can raise awareness, they also remind him of his original passion for the ocean.

new_src_summary:
本文由环保摄影师托马斯•佩斯查克撰写，回顾了他从小对海洋的幻想及其职业生涯的发展，描绘了自己童年时对海洋生物的热爱，尤其是色彩斑斓的鱼群和优雅的海龟，并回忆了10岁时第一次潜水的经历。作为前海洋生物学家，他在过去40年中为《国家地理杂志》和“拯救我们的海洋”基金会拍摄了各种海洋生物，从巨型鲨鱼到小型鱼类。尽管他有幸探索了美妙的海洋景观，但他也意识到，随着人类活动的增加，纯净的海洋正变得愈加稀少，面临着越来越多的威胁。文章传达了对海洋环境保护的关注，强调了每个人都能影响海洋，并呼吁人们重视这一问题。

此外，文中探讨了摄影在传播爱与保护生态中的重要性，作者自认为是人类与动物之间的桥梁，通过摄影揭示隐藏在海洋深处的动物与生态系统的美丽与神秘。特别描述了魔鬼鱼的独特捕食行为，包括分散时的单独捕食和聚集时的“旋风捕食法”，展现了其捕食的智慧和团队协作。作者分享了在哈尼法鲁拍摄时的体验，以及通过与非政府组织合作推动该地区成为海洋保护区的过程，强调了魔鬼鱼对当地经济的重要性。同时，他也提到在南非观察到的“沙丁鱼潮”现象，强调了海豚与鲨鱼在捕猎沙丁鱼时的共生关系，展示了自然界中物种间的相互依赖。整体风格感性而深思，语气中带有对美好海洋的怀念与对未来的忧虑，同时充满热情与敬畏，旨在唤起人们对海洋生物及其生态系统的关注与爱护。
new_tgt_summary: Thomas Pescechak, a former marine biologist turned environmental photographer, reflects on his lifelong fascination with the ocean, inspired by its vibrant life and beauty. Over 40 years, he has explored diverse ocean landscapes and captured images for National Geographic and the "Save Our Seas" Foundation. His memorable experiences include swimming with a humpback whale in Canada, observing green sea turtles in Mozambique, and witnessing the "sardine run" in South Africa, where migrating sardines are hunted by dolphins and sharks, showcasing a unique coexistence. He emphasizes the importance of raising awareness about ocean ecosystems to foster love and protection for them. Despite increasing human threats that make the pristine ocean he once dreamed of harder to find, Pescechak believes that spreading love is key to bringing about change. He recounts close encounters with non-threatening sharks during the sardine run and his journey to the Maldives, where he dove among devil rays that now gather near Hanifaru Island to feed on small shrimp and crabs, utilizing a "whirlwind feeding technique" when plankton is abundant. Once threatened by local development and previously hunted by fishermen, devil rays now contribute over $8 million annually to the Maldives economy, thanks to collaborations with organizations like the "Devil Ray Trust." Pescechak reminisces about remote atolls in the Indian Ocean and a small coral atoll in the Mozambique Channel where Galapagos sharks thrive, reinforcing his commitment to marine conservation. Earlier this year, he also traveled to the Baja California Peninsula to photograph gray whales in the San Ignacio Lagoon, a crucial breeding ground. Ultimately, he feels that while shocking photographs can raise awareness, they also remind him of his original passion for the ocean.

rel_tgt: I want to convey a message through my photographs: it is not too late to start saving the ocean.
I particularly want to focus on the restorative power of nature in the face of 7.3 billion people.

src: 我总是怀着这样的一个假设在拍照， 下一张能够带来改变的伟大照片 就在前面等我， 也许就在下一个珊瑚礁后面， 在下一个环礁湖里， 要不然，就在再下一个。
ref: And I always operate on the assumption  that the next great picture that will effect change  is right around the corner,  behind the next coral head,  inside the next lagoon  or possibly, in the one after it.
hyp: I always shoot with the assumption that the next great photograph that could bring about change is waiting for me just ahead, perhaps behind the next coral reef, in the next lagoon, or maybe in the one after that.
rel_src: 我以前从未在一个珊瑚环礁湖中 看到过如此多的鲨鱼。
我想通过自己的照片， 传递一个信息，从现在开始 拯救海洋还不算太晚。
rel_tgt: I had never seen so many sharks in a coral lagoon before.
I want to convey a message through my photographs: it is not too late to start saving the ocean.
